REGULATOR ASSESSMENT

Data

library(ggplot2)
library(bbplot)
library(dplyr)
library(tidyr)
library(bbplot)
library(readxl)
data <- read_excel("data/regulator.xlsx")
colnames(data)
  1. 'Timestamp'
  2. 'Name'
  3. 'Institution'
  4. 'Position'
  5. 'Department'
  6. 'Location/Address'
  7. 'City'
  8. 'Province'
  9. 'Phone number/Email'
  10. 'Time of Employment (Year and Month)'
  11. '1. Are there any regulations regarding the supervision of MSMEs and street food businesses in local?'
  12. 'If yes, please list'
  13. '2. Which institution/agency has the authority to supervise MSMEs and street food businesses?'
  14. '3. Is it mandatory for every MSME and street food business to have a permit or registration?'
  15. '4. Does the institution/agency have a business registration permit service for MSMEs and food street?'
  16. '5. Are there systems, mechanisms and procedures for granting permits to MSMEs and food street?'
  17. '6. Does the institution/agency have a complaint service regarding licensing of food business registration certificates for MSMEs and street vendors?'
  18. '7. How long does it take to complete a business registration permit for MSMEs and street vendors?'
  19. '8. How much does it cost to register a business license for MSMEs and street vendors?'
  20. '9. Does the Institution/Agency have a supervision plan for MSMEs and street food businesses?'
  21. '10. Does the Institution/Agency carry out routine and scheduled supervision of MSMEs and street food businesses?'
  22. '11. Does the institution/agency monitor expired products in MSMEs and street vendors in your area?'
  23. '12. Does the institution/agency undergo test on contaminated food and feed materials for traceability purposes?'
  24. '13. How does the institution/agency supervise or evaluate the compliance on regulation by MSMEs and street food businesses?'
  25. 'If the answer to the previous question (Question 13) is "Other", please specify'
  26. '14. In the compliance evaluation on MSMEs and street food vendors, what issues that often fail to meet the requirements?'
  27. 'If the answer to the previous question (Question 14) is "Other", please specify'
  28. '15. Have there ever been cases of poisoning in your area?'
  29. '16. How many times does the Institution/Agency conduct field monitoring of MSMEs and street food business in 1 year?'
  30. '17. Are the results of supervision on MSMEs and street food businesses published?'
  31. '18. Does the institution/agency provide training for MSMEs and street food businesses?'
  32. '19. Does the Institution/Agency provide training related to food safety to MSME and street food entrepreneurs?'
  33. '20. Has the Institution/Agency ever received consumer complaints regarding street food vendors?'
  34. '21. What consumer complaints that are usually reported?'
  35. 'If the answer to the previous question (Question 21) is "Other", please specify'
  36. '22. Does the institution/agency have a program related to improving food safety in your work area that you can share?'
  37. 'If the answer to the previous question (Question 22) is "Other", please specify'

Legality

# Count responses
response_counts <- as.data.frame(table(data$`1. Are there any regulations regarding the supervision of MSMEs and street food businesses in local?`))
colnames(response_counts) <- c("Response", "Count")

# Calculate percentages
response_counts$Percentage <- round(response_counts$Count / sum(response_counts$Count) * 100, 1)

# Pie chart with custom styling
options(repr.plot.width=10, repr.plot.height=6)
ggplot(response_counts, aes(x = "", y = Count, fill = Response)) +
  geom_col(width = 1, color = "white") +
  coord_polar(theta = "y") +
  geom_text(aes(label = paste0(Percentage, "%")), 
            position = position_stack(vjust = 0.5), 
            size = 5) +
scale_fill_manual(values = c("#2196F3", "#FFC107")) +
  theme_void() +
  theme(
    plot.background = element_rect(fill = "#ffffff", color = NA),
    panel.grid = element_blank(),
    axis.text = element_blank(),
    axis.title = element_blank(),
    legend.position = "right",
    legend.title = element_blank(),
    plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5, size = 18, face = "bold"),
    legend.text = element_text(size = 15)
  ) +
labs(
    title = "Are there any regulations regarding the supervision of MSMEs\nand street food businesses in local?",
    ) +
    annotate("text", x = 1, y = 0, label = paste0("n = ", sum(response_counts$Count)), 
    size = 5, hjust = -3, vjust = 20)

Most regulators (88.9%) reported having regulations for supervising MSMEs and street food businesses locally, while only 11.1% indicated no such regulations exist.

# Count responses
permit_counts <- as.data.frame(table(data$`3. Is it mandatory for every MSME and street food business to have a permit or registration?`))
colnames(permit_counts) <- c("Response", "Count")

# Calculate percentages
permit_counts$Percentage <- round(permit_counts$Count / sum(permit_counts$Count) * 100, 1)

# Pie chart with custom styling
options(repr.plot.width=10, repr.plot.height=6)
ggplot(permit_counts, aes(x = "", y = Count, fill = Response)) +
    geom_col(width = 1, color = "white") +
    coord_polar(theta = "y") +
    geom_text(aes(label = paste0(Percentage, "%")), 
                        position = position_stack(vjust = 0.5), 
                        size = 5) +
    scale_fill_manual(values = c("#2196F3", "#FFC107")) +
    theme_void() +
    theme(
        plot.background = element_rect(fill = "#ffffff", color = NA),
        panel.grid = element_blank(),
        axis.text = element_blank(),
        axis.title = element_blank(),
        legend.position = "right",
        legend.title = element_blank(),
        plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5, size = 18, face = "bold"),
        legend.text = element_text(size = 15)
    ) +
    labs(
        title = "Is it mandatory for every MSME\nand street food business to have a permit or registration?"
    ) +
    annotate("text", x = 1, y = 0, label = paste0("n = ", sum(permit_counts$Count)), 
                     size = 5, hjust = -3, vjust = 20)

According to survey data, a strong majority (77.8%) of regulators indicated that permits or registrations are mandatory for MSMEs and street food businesses, while 22.2% reported that such formal documentation is not required.

# Count responses
service_counts <- as.data.frame(table(data$`4. Does the institution/agency have a business registration permit service for MSMEs and food street?`))
colnames(service_counts) <- c("Response", "Count")

# Calculate percentages

    coord_polar(theta = "y") +

                        position = position_stack(vjust = 0.5),

        plot.background = element_rect(fill = "#ffffff", color = NA),

        axis.text = element_blank(),

        legend.position = "right",
        legend.title = element_blank(),
        plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5, size = 18, face = "bold"),
        legend.text = element_text(size = 15)
    ) +
    labs(
        title = "Does the institution/agency have a business registration \npermit service for MSMEs and food street?"
    ) +
    annotate("text", x = 1, y = 0, label = paste0("n = ", sum(service_counts$Count)), 
                     size = 5, hjust = -3, vjust = 20)

Most regulators (88.9%) reported having business registration permit services for MSMEs and street food businesses, while only 11.1% indicated no such services exist.

# Count responses
system_counts <- as.data.frame(table(data$`5. Are there systems, mechanisms and procedures for granting permits to MSMEs and food street?`))
colnames(system_counts) <- c("Response", "Count")

# Calculate percentages
system_counts$Percentage <- round(system_counts$Count / sum(system_counts$Count) * 100, 1)

# Pie chart with custom styling
options(repr.plot.width=10, repr.plot.height=6)
ggplot(system_counts, aes(x = "", y = Count, fill = Response)) +
    geom_col(width = 1, color = "white") +
    coord_polar(theta = "y") +
    geom_text(aes(label = paste0(Percentage, "%")), 
                        position = position_stack(vjust = 0.5), 
                        size = 5) +
    scale_fill_manual(values = c("#FFC107", "#FFC107")) +
    theme_void() +
    theme(
        plot.background = element_rect(fill = "#ffffff", color = NA),
        panel.grid = element_blank(),
        axis.text = element_blank(),
        axis.title = element_blank(),
        legend.position = "right",
        legend.title = element_blank(),
        plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5, size = 18, face = "bold"),
        legend.text = element_text(size = 15)
    ) +
    labs(
        title = "Are there systems, mechanisms and procedures \nfor granting permits to MSMEs and food street?"
    ) +
    annotate("text", x = 1, y = 0, label = paste0("n = ", sum(system_counts$Count)), 
                     size = 5, hjust = -3, vjust = 20)

All regulators (100%) reported having systems, mechanisms and procedures in place for granting permits to MSMEs and street food businesses.

# Count responses
complaint_counts <- as.data.frame(table(data$`6. Does the institution/agency have a complaint service regarding licensing of food business registration certificates for MSMEs and street vendors?`))
colnames(complaint_counts) <- c("Response", "Count")

# Calculate percentages
complaint_counts$Percentage <- round(complaint_counts$Count / sum(complaint_counts$Count) * 100, 1)

# Pie chart with custom styling
options(repr.plot.width=10, repr.plot.height=6)
ggplot(complaint_counts, aes(x = "", y = Count, fill = Response)) +
    geom_col(width = 1, color = "white") +
    coord_polar(theta = "y") +
    geom_text(aes(label = paste0(Percentage, "%")), 
                        position = position_stack(vjust = 0.5), 
                        size = 5) +

    theme_void() +
    theme(
        plot.background = element_rect(fill = "#ffffff", color = NA),
        panel.grid = element_blank(),
        axis.text = element_blank(),
        axis.title = element_blank(),
        legend.position = "right",
        legend.title = element_blank(),
        plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5, size = 18, face = "bold"),
        legend.text = element_text(size = 15)
    ) +
    labs(
        title = "Does the institution/agency have a complaint service regarding licensing\nof food business registration certificates for MSMEs and street vendors?"
    ) +
    annotate("text", x = 1, y = 0, label = paste0("n = ", sum(complaint_counts$Count)), 
                     size = 5, hjust = -3, vjust = 20)

Most regulatory agencies (87.5%) provide complaint services related to licensing of food business registration certificates for MSMEs and street vendors, while a small minority (12.5%) do not offer such services.

# Count responses
duration_counts <- as.data.frame(table(data$`7. How long does it take to complete a business registration permit for MSMEs and street vendors?`))
colnames(duration_counts) <- c("Response", "Count")

# Calculate percentages
duration_counts$Percentage <- round(duration_counts$Count / sum(duration_counts$Count) * 100, 1)

# Pie chart with custom styling
options(repr.plot.width=10, repr.plot.height=6)
ggplot(duration_counts, aes(x = "", y = Count, fill = Response)) +
    geom_col(width = 1, color = "white") +
    coord_polar(theta = "y") +
    geom_text(aes(label = paste0(Percentage, "%")), 
                        position = position_stack(vjust = 0.5), 
                        size = 5) +
    scale_fill_manual(values = c("#2196F3", "#FFC107", "#4CAF50", "#E91E63")) +
    theme_void() +
    theme(
        plot.background = element_rect(fill = "#ffffff", color = NA),
        panel.grid = element_blank(),
        axis.text = element_blank(),
        axis.title = element_blank(),
        legend.position = "right",
        legend.title = element_blank(),
        plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5, size = 18, face = "bold"),
        legend.text = element_text(size = 15)
    ) +
    labs(
        title = "How long does it take to complete a business registration permit\nfor MSMEs and street vendors?"
    ) +
    annotate("text", x = 1, y = 0, label = paste0("n = ", sum(duration_counts$Count)), 
                     size = 5, hjust = -3, vjust = 20)

According to survey data, half of the regulators (50%) reported that business registration permits for MSMEs and street vendors can be completed in less than 2 days, while the other half (50%) indicated it takes more than 1 week to process, with no regulators reporting processing times in the intermediate ranges of 3-5 days or 6-7 days.

# Count responses
cost_counts <- as.data.frame(table(data$`8. How much does it cost to register a business license for MSMEs and street vendors?`))
colnames(cost_counts) <- c("Response", "Count")

# Calculate percentages
cost_counts$Percentage <- round(cost_counts$Count / sum(cost_counts$Count) * 100, 1)

# Pie chart with custom styling
options(repr.plot.width=10, repr.plot.height=6)
ggplot(cost_counts, aes(x = "", y = Count, fill = Response)) +
    geom_col(width = 1, color = "white") +
    coord_polar(theta = "y") +
    geom_text(aes(label = paste0(Percentage, "%")), 
                        position = position_stack(vjust = 0.5), 
                        size = 5) +
    scale_fill_manual(values = c("#2196F3", "#FFC107", "#4CAF50", "#E91E63")) +
    theme_void() +
    theme(
        plot.background = element_rect(fill = "#ffffff", color = NA),
        panel.grid = element_blank(),
        axis.text = element_blank(),
        axis.title = element_blank(),
        legend.position = "right",
        legend.title = element_blank(),
        plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5, size = 18, face = "bold"),
        legend.text = element_text(size = 15)
    ) +
    labs(
        title = "How much does it cost to register a business license\nfor MSMEs and street vendors?"
    ) +
    annotate("text", x = 1, y = 0, label = paste0("n = ", sum(cost_counts$Count)), 
                     size = 5, hjust = -3, vjust = 20)

Business registration costs are evenly split, with half of regulatory agencies (50%) offering completely free registration services and the other half (50%) charging a fee. No regulators reported offering subsidized registration options.

Control/Supervision

# Count responses
supervision_counts <- as.data.frame(table(data$`9. Does the Institution/Agency have a supervision plan for MSMEs and street food businesses?`))
colnames(supervision_counts) <- c("Response", "Count")

# Calculate percentages
supervision_counts$Percentage <- round(supervision_counts$Count / sum(supervision_counts$Count) * 100, 1)

# Pie chart with custom styling
options(repr.plot.width=10, repr.plot.height=6)
ggplot(supervision_counts, aes(x = "", y = Count, fill = Response)) +
    geom_col(width = 1, color = "white") +
    coord_polar(theta = "y") +
    geom_text(aes(label = paste0(Percentage, "%")), 
                        position = position_stack(vjust = 0.5), 
                        size = 5) +
    scale_fill_manual(values = c("#2196F3", "#FFC107")) +
    theme_void() +
    theme(
        plot.background = element_rect(fill = "#ffffff", color = NA),
        panel.grid = element_blank(),
        axis.text = element_blank(),
        axis.title = element_blank(),
        legend.position = "right",
        legend.title = element_blank(),
        plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5, size = 18, face = "bold"),
        legend.text = element_text(size = 15)
    ) +
    labs(
        title = "Does the Institution/Agency have a supervision plan\nfor MSMEs and street food businesses?"
    ) +
    annotate("text", x = 1, y = 0, label = paste0("n = ", sum(supervision_counts$Count)), 
                     size = 5, hjust = -3, vjust = 20)

Most regulatory agencies (85.7%) have supervision plans in place for MSMEs and street food businesses, while a small minority (14.3%) do not have formal planning for such oversight activities.

# Count responses
routine_supervision_counts <- as.data.frame(table(data$`10. Does the Institution/Agency carry out routine and scheduled supervision of MSMEs and street food businesses?`))
colnames(routine_supervision_counts) <- c("Response", "Count")

# Calculate percentages
routine_supervision_counts$Percentage <- round(routine_supervision_counts$Count / sum(routine_supervision_counts$Count) * 100, 1)

# Pie chart with custom styling

    geom_col(width = 1, color = "white") +
    coord_polar(theta = "y") +

                        position = position_stack(vjust = 0.5), 
                        size = 5) +

    theme_void() +
    theme(
        plot.background = element_rect(fill = "#ffffff", color = NA),

        axis.text = element_blank(),
        axis.title = element_blank(),
        legend.position = "right",
        legend.title = element_blank(),
        plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5, size = 18, face = "bold"),
        legend.text = element_text(size = 15)
    ) +
    labs(
        title = "Does the Institution/Agency carry out routine and \nscheduled supervision of MSMEs and street food businesses?"
    ) +
    annotate("text", x = 1, y = 0, label = paste0("n = ", sum(routine_supervision_counts$Count)), 
                     size = 5, hjust = -3, vjust = 20)

Most regulatory agencies (85.7%) conduct routine and scheduled supervision of MSMEs and street food businesses, while a small minority (14.3%) do not perform such regular oversight activities.

# Count responses
expired_monitor_counts <- as.data.frame(table(data$`11. Does the institution/agency monitor expired products in MSMEs and street vendors in your area?`))
colnames(expired_monitor_counts) <- c("Response", "Count")

# Calculate percentages
expired_monitor_counts$Percentage <- round(expired_monitor_counts$Count / sum(expired_monitor_counts$Count) * 100, 1)

    ) +

    ) +

                     size = 5, hjust = -3, vjust = 20)

Most regulatory agencies (85.7%) monitor expired products in MSMEs and street vendors in their areas, while a small minority (14.3%) do not conduct such product expiration monitoring.

# Count responses
test_counts <- as.data.frame(table(data$`12. Does the institution/agency undergo test on contaminated food and feed materials for traceability purposes?`))
colnames(test_counts) <- c("Response", "Count")

# Calculate percentages

    ) +
    annotate("text", x = 1, y = 0, label = paste0("n = ", sum(test_counts$Count)), 
                     size = 5, hjust = -3, vjust = 20)

Most regulatory agencies (85.7%) conduct testing on contaminated food and feed materials for traceability purposes, while a small minority (14.3%) do not perform such testing activities.

# Replace "Administrative evaluation, General survey, Sampling test" with "Administrative evaluation, \nGeneral survey, Sampling test"
data$`13. How does the institution/agency supervise or evaluate the compliance on regulation by MSMEs and street food businesses?` <- 
    gsub("Administrative evaluation, General survey, Sampling test", 
             "Administrative evaluation, \nGeneral survey, Sampling test", 
             data$`13. How does the institution/agency supervise or evaluate the compliance on regulation by MSMEs and street food businesses?`)
# Count responses
compliance_counts <- as.data.frame(table(data$`13. How does the institution/agency supervise or evaluate the compliance on regulation by MSMEs and street food businesses?`))
colnames(compliance_counts) <- c("Response", "Count")

# Calculate percentages
compliance_counts$Percentage <- round(compliance_counts$Count / sum(compliance_counts$Count) * 100, 1)

# Horizontal bar chart with custom styling
    options(repr.plot.width=14, repr.plot.height=8)  # Increased height and width
ggplot(compliance_counts, aes(x = reorder(Response, Count), y = Count, fill = Response)) +
  geom_col(width = 0.7, color = "white") +
  geom_text(aes(label = paste0(Count, " (", Percentage, "%)")), 
            hjust = -0.1, size = 5) +
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("#2196F3", "#2196F3", "#2196F3", "#2196F3", "#2196F3")) +
  coord_flip() +
  scale_y_continuous(expand = expansion(mult = c(0, 0.3))) +  # Add more space for labels
  bbc_style() + 
  labs(
    y = "",
    title = "How does the institution/agency supervise or evaluate \ncompliance on regulation by MSMEs and street food businesses?"
  ) +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 20),
    legend.position = "none"  # Remove legend since colors are the same
  )

Regulatory agencies employ diverse oversight methods for MSMEs and street food businesses. Of these, 28.6% use comprehensive approaches that combine administrative evaluation, general surveys, and sampling tests. Another 42.9% use single methods such as administrative evaluation, general surveys, or sampling tests individually. The remaining 28.6% use specialized methods like surveillance audits or rely solely on a policy unit.

# Count responses
issue_counts <- as.data.frame(table(data$`14. In the compliance evaluation on MSMEs and street food vendors, what issues that often fail to meet the requirements?`))
colnames(issue_counts) <- c("Issue", "Count")

# Calculate percentages
issue_counts$Percentage <- round(issue_counts$Count / sum(issue_counts$Count) * 100, 1)

# Horizontal bar chart with custom styling
options(repr.plot.width=14, repr.plot.height=8)
ggplot(issue_counts, aes(x = reorder(Issue, Count), y = Count, fill = Issue)) +
    geom_col(width = 0.7, color = "white") +
    geom_text(aes(label = paste0(Count, " (", Percentage, "%)")), 
                        hjust = -0.1, size = 5) +
    scale_fill_manual(values = rep("#2196F3", nrow(issue_counts))) +
    coord_flip() +
    scale_y_continuous(expand = expansion(mult = c(0, 0.3))) +
    bbc_style() +
    labs(
        y = "",
        title = "What issues often fail to meet requirements in compliance evaluation\non MSMEs and street food vendors?"
    ) +
    theme(
        plot.title = element_text(size = 20),
        legend.position = "none"
    )

Cleanliness is the primary compliance issue for MSMEs and street food vendors (42.9%), with additional concerns including cleanliness combined with waste management or staff competence (28.6% combined), and other unspecified issues (28.6%).

# Count responses
poisoning_counts <- as.data.frame(table(data$`15. Have there ever been cases of poisoning in your area?`))
colnames(poisoning_counts) <- c("Response", "Count")

# Calculate percentages
poisoning_counts$Percentage <- round(poisoning_counts$Count / sum(poisoning_counts$Count) * 100, 1)

# Pie chart with custom styling
options(repr.plot.width=10, repr.plot.height=6)
ggplot(poisoning_counts, aes(x = "", y = Count, fill = Response)) +
    geom_col(width = 1, color = "white") +
    coord_polar(theta = "y") +
    geom_text(aes(label = paste0(Percentage, "%")), 
                        position = position_stack(vjust = 0.5), 
                        size = 5) +
    scale_fill_manual(values = c("#2196F3", "#FFC107")) +
    theme_void() +
    theme(
        plot.background = element_rect(fill = "#ffffff", color = NA),
        panel.grid = element_blank(),
        axis.text = element_blank(),
        axis.title = element_blank(),
        legend.position = "right",
        legend.title = element_blank(),
        plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5, size = 18, face = "bold"),
        legend.text = element_text(size = 15)
    ) +
    labs(
        title = "Have there ever been cases of poisoning in your area?"
    ) +
    annotate("text", x = 1, y = 0, label = paste0("n = ", sum(poisoning_counts$Count)), 
                     size = 5, hjust = -4, vjust = 20)

Slightly more than half of regulatory agencies (57.1%) have experienced cases of food poisoning in their areas, while 42.9% have not.

# Count responses
monitoring_counts <- as.data.frame(table(data$`16. How many times does the Institution/Agency conduct field monitoring of MSMEs and street food business in 1 year?`))
colnames(monitoring_counts) <- c("Frequency", "Count")

# Calculate percentages
monitoring_counts$Percentage <- round(monitoring_counts$Count / sum(monitoring_counts$Count) * 100, 1)

# Bar chart with custom styling
options(repr.plot.width=12, repr.plot.height=7)
ggplot(monitoring_counts, aes(x = reorder(Frequency, Count), y = Count, fill = Frequency)) +
    geom_col(width = 0.7, color = "white") +
    geom_text(aes(label = paste0(Count, " (", Percentage, "%)")), 
                        hjust = -0.1, size = 5) +
    scale_fill_manual(values = rep("#2196F3", nrow(monitoring_counts))) +
    coord_flip() +
    scale_y_continuous(expand = expansion(mult = c(0, 0.2))) +
    bbc_style() +
    labs(
        y = "",
        title = "How many times does the Institution/Agency conduct field monitoring\nof MSMEs and street food business in 1 year?"
    ) +
    theme(
        plot.title = element_text(size = 20),
        legend.position = "none"
    )

Half of regulatory agencies (50%) conduct field monitoring just once per year, while the remaining agencies are evenly split between those conducting monitoring more than once per year, those with unscheduled monitoring, and those that never conduct field monitoring.

# Count responses
publish_counts <- as.data.frame(table(data$`17. Are the results of supervision on MSMEs and street food businesses published?`))
colnames(publish_counts) <- c("Response", "Count")

# Calculate percentages
publish_counts$Percentage <- round(publish_counts$Count / sum(publish_counts$Count) * 100, 1)

# Pie chart with custom styling
options(repr.plot.width=10, repr.plot.height=6)
ggplot(publish_counts, aes(x = "", y = Count, fill = Response)) +
    geom_col(width = 1, color = "white") +
    coord_polar(theta = "y") +
    geom_text(aes(label = paste0(Percentage, "%")), 
                        position = position_stack(vjust = 0.5), 
                        size = 5) +
    scale_fill_manual(values = c("#2196F3", "#FFC107")) +
    theme_void() +
    theme(
        plot.background = element_rect(fill = "#ffffff", color = NA),
        panel.grid = element_blank(),
        axis.text = element_blank(),
        axis.title = element_blank(),
        legend.position = "right",
        legend.title = element_blank(),
        plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5, size = 18, face = "bold"),
        legend.text = element_text(size = 15)
    ) +
    labs(
        title = "Are the results of supervision on MSMEs \nand street food businesses published?"
    ) +
    annotate("text", x = 1, y = 0, label = paste0("n = ", sum(publish_counts$Count)), 
                     size = 5, hjust = -4, vjust = 20)

Two-thirds of regulatory agencies (66.7%) do not publish their supervision results for MSMEs and street food businesses, while only one-third (33.3%) make these findings public.

Foster of street vendors

# Count responses
food_safety_training_counts <- as.data.frame(table(data$`19. Does the Institution/Agency provide training related to food safety to MSME and street food entrepreneurs?`))
colnames(food_safety_training_counts) <- c("Response", "Count")

# Calculate percentages
food_safety_training_counts$Percentage <- round(food_safety_training_counts$Count / sum(food_safety_training_counts$Count) * 100, 1)

# Pie chart with custom styling
options(repr.plot.width=10, repr.plot.height=6)

    geom_col(width = 1, color = "white") +
    coord_polar(theta = "y") +
    geom_text(aes(label = paste0(Percentage, "%")), 
                        position = position_stack(vjust = 0.5), 
                        size = 5) +
    scale_fill_manual(values = c("#2196F3", "#FFC107")) +
    theme_void() +
    theme(
        plot.background = element_rect(fill = "#ffffff", color = NA),
        panel.grid = element_blank(),
        axis.text = element_blank(),
        axis.title = element_blank(),
        legend.position = "right",
        legend.title = element_blank(),
        plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5, size = 18, face = "bold"),
        legend.text = element_text(size = 15)
    ) +
    labs(
        title = "Does the Institution/Agency provide training related to \nfood safety to MSME and street food entrepreneurs?"
    ) +
    annotate("text", x = 1, y = 0, label = paste0("n = ", sum(food_safety_training_counts$Count)), 
                     size = 5, hjust = -4, vjust = 20)

A majority (71.4%) of regulatory agencies provide specialized food safety training to MSME and street food entrepreneurs, while 28.6% do not offer such focused training programs.

# Count responses
complaint_received_counts <- as.data.frame(table(data$`20. Has the Institution/Agency ever received consumer complaints regarding street food vendors?`))
colnames(complaint_received_counts) <- c("Response", "Count")

# Calculate percentages
complaint_received_counts$Percentage <- round(complaint_received_counts$Count / sum(complaint_received_counts$Count) * 100, 1)

# Pie chart with custom styling
options(repr.plot.width=10, repr.plot.height=6)
ggplot(complaint_received_counts, aes(x = "", y = Count, fill = Response)) +
    geom_col(width = 1, color = "white") +
    coord_polar(theta = "y") +
    geom_text(aes(label = paste0(Percentage, "%")), 
                        position = position_stack(vjust = 0.5), 
                        size = 5) +
    scale_fill_manual(values = c("#2196F3", "#FFC107")) +
    theme_void() +
    theme(
        plot.background = element_rect(fill = "#ffffff", color = NA),
        panel.grid = element_blank(),
        axis.text = element_blank(),
        axis.title = element_blank(),
        legend.position = "right",
        legend.title = element_blank(),
        plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5, size = 18, face = "bold"),
        legend.text = element_text(size = 15)
    ) +
    labs(
        title = "Has the Institution/Agency ever received \nconsumer complaints regarding street food vendors?"
    ) +
    annotate("text", x = 1, y = 0, label = paste0("n = ", sum(complaint_received_counts$Count)), 
                     size = 5, hjust = -4, vjust = 20)

The vast majority of regulatory agencies (83.3%) have received consumer complaints about street food vendors, while only a small percentage (16.7%) report never having received such complaints.

# Count responses
complaint_type_counts <- as.data.frame(table(data$`21. What consumer complaints that are usually reported?`))
colnames(complaint_type_counts) <- c("Complaint", "Count")

# Calculate percentages
complaint_type_counts$Percentage <- round(complaint_type_counts$Count / sum(complaint_type_counts$Count) * 100, 1)

# Horizontal bar chart with custom styling
options(repr.plot.width=14, repr.plot.height=8)
ggplot(complaint_type_counts, aes(x = reorder(Complaint, Count), y = Count, fill = Complaint)) +
    geom_col(width = 0.7, color = "white") +
    geom_text(aes(label = paste0(Count, " (", Percentage, "%)")), 
                        hjust = -0.1, size = 5) +
    scale_fill_manual(values = rep("#2196F3", nrow(complaint_type_counts))) +
    coord_flip() +
    scale_y_continuous(expand = expansion(mult = c(0, 0.3))) +
    bbc_style() +
    labs(
        y = "",
        title = "What consumer complaints are usually reported?"
    ) +
    theme(
        plot.title = element_text(size = 20),
        legend.position = "none"
    )

Consumer complaints are mostly about cleanliness (28.6%). The remaining complaints are evenly distributed among food safety issues, combined food safety and cleanliness concerns, and permit-related problems. Other issues include product halalness.

# Count responses
food_safety_program_counts <- as.data.frame(table(data$`22. Does the institution/agency have a program related to improving food safety in your work area that you can share?`))
colnames(food_safety_program_counts) <- c("Response", "Count")

# Calculate percentages
food_safety_program_counts$Percentage <- round(food_safety_program_counts$Count / sum(food_safety_program_counts$Count) * 100, 1)

# Pie chart with custom styling
options(repr.plot.width=10, repr.plot.height=6)
ggplot(food_safety_program_counts, aes(x = "", y = Count, fill = Response)) +
    geom_col(width = 1, color = "white") +
    coord_polar(theta = "y") +
    geom_text(aes(label = paste0(Percentage, "%")), 
                        position = position_stack(vjust = 0.5), 
                        size = 5) +
    scale_fill_manual(values = c("#2196F3", "#FFC107")) +
    theme_void() +
    theme(
        plot.background = element_rect(fill = "#ffffff", color = NA),
        panel.grid = element_blank(),
        axis.text = element_blank(),
        axis.title = element_blank(),
        legend.position = "right",
        legend.title = element_blank(),
        plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5, size = 18, face = "bold"),
        legend.text = element_text(size = 15)
    ) +
    labs(
        title = "Does the institution/agency have a program related \nto improving food safety in your work area that you can share?"
    ) +
    annotate("text", x = 1, y = 0, label = paste0("n = ", sum(food_safety_program_counts$Count)), 
                     size = 5, hjust = -4, vjust = 20)

Most regulatory agencies (71.4%) have established programs related to improving food safety, while 28.6% report not having such shareable food safety improvement programs.

REGULATOR ASSESSMENT FOR FOOD SAFETY IN MSMEs AND STREET FOOD BUSINESSES
